page.title: 06V.E.Day in Skewen.
page.content: At the moment we are celebrating the end of the 2nd World War.It is the 40th anniversary of the ending of hostilities between Great Britain and Germany. This morning Mrs.Jones's class held an assembly in school.During the assembly the children told us about Skewen during the war.The German bombers bombed a row of houses and a man was killed.Many people left Skewen because it was so dangerous.Tanks in the oil refinery were also blown up.They caused fires which lit up the village and everyone thought that the Germans would come back to bomb Skewen but they never did. There is a memorial stone in Skewen and so the whole class went to look at it.We had to draw it.We found that 64 men from Skewen lost their lives.
